title: Cool Down: Natural Care for Sun-Exposed Skin
author: Harish
excerpt: Simple, cooling botanicals soothe sunburn and heat rash—learn preventive tips and how to use topical aloe-cucumber gels safely.
content:
Immediate Care for Sun-Exposed Skin

For mild sunburn or heat rash, cooling topical agents and hydration are key. Aloe and cucumber reduce heat and provide instant comfort; rose water adds soothing aroma and cooling effect.

How to Apply Safely

  1. Cool the skin with a damp, cool (not icy) cloth.
  2. Apply a generous layer of cooling gel to the affected areas.
  3. Reapply every few hours or after washing/sweating.

When to See a Doctor

If blisters form, skin is severely painful, or systemic symptoms like fever or nausea occur, seek immediate medical attention—these are signs of severe sunburn requiring professional care.
